title: Donation of 'urgent materials'
description: On June 24, 2011, Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Zhai Jun held talks with Ivory Coast President Alassane Outtara and announced that the Chinese government would send 'urgent material needs.'
sources: http://vlex.cn/vid/deeply-fighting-poverty-cote-ivoire-323722219, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020110625e76p001b9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gbooza.com/group/insideafrica/forum/topics/chinese-vice-foreign-minister#axzz2a5KsSxlt, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zhai Jun, ; Daniel Kablan Duncan, ; Alassane Ouattara,

title: Donation of 100 computers and 30 printers to Outapi
description: In 2006, the Chinese Ambassador to Namibia donated 100 computers and 30 printers to the Outapi Town Council in the Omusati Region. There to receive the donation was Regional and Local Government Minister John Pandeni. The donation was part of the exchanges and cooperation between Outapi and Yinchuan, a Chinese twin city. The Chief Executive Officer of Outapi, Oswin Namakalu, said 20 of the 100 computers would go to the Town Council, 10 to local government agencies and the remaining 70 to various schools in the region.
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/200609130303.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_chn/wjdt_611265/zwbd_611281/t441899.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Liang Yinzhu, Chinese Ambassador (Chinese Embassy); John Pandeni,

title: Donation of 18-seater minibus
description: On December 19, 2012, Liberian President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf donated an 18-seat minibus to Obaa's Girls Educational Outreach, a non-governmental organization that advocates on behalf of underprivileged children. President Sirleaf received the minibus as a birthday gift from the Chinese Ambassador to Liberia Zhao Jianhua.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020121220e8ck001dm&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.frontpageafricaonline.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4930:early-christmas-for-obaas-girls-president-sirleaf-donates-18-seater-minibus&catid=67:news&Itemid=144, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Obaa's Girls Educational Outreach, National NGO
contacts: Zhao Jianhua, Chinese Ambassador to Liberia (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Miatta Fahnbulleh, Executive Director, Obaa's Girls Educational Outreach

title: Donation of 3 Billion CFA Francs to the Congo
description: In 2011, the People's Republic of China donated 3,963,880,000 CFA francs to the Republic of Congo. The related agreement was signed on December 29 in Brazzaville by the Chinese Ambassador to Congo, Li Shu Li, and the Congolese Minister of Finance, Budget, and Public Portfolio, Gilbert Ondongo. The donation is intended to fund projects that would be determined later by the two parties.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-don-de-plus-de-3-milliards-de-francs-CFA-a-la-Republique-du-Congo_a11443.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Gilbert Ondongo, Minister of Finance, Budget and Public Portfolio ; Li Shu Li, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of 30 vehicles
description: In October 2012, China signed an aid agreement with Niger for the donation of 30 vehicles worth 1.9 million USD. At the same time, they also signed an aid agreement to provide 25.6 million USD to build a national referral hospital in Niamey (project ID #30415).
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=MENREP0020121029e8at0001p&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://allafrica.com/stories/201210290158.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Shi Hu, Chinese Ambassador to Niger ; Bazoum Mohamed, Niger's Cooperation Minister

title: Donation of 6 computers to Ministry of Works
description: In 2006, China's Ambassador to Namibia, Liang Yinzhu, donated six computers to the Namibian Minister of Works, Joel Kaapanda. It is unclear what the value of the equipment is.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020060908e298000oe&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/ce/cena/chn/zngx/t271297.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of 85 vehicles to Ministry of Foreign Affairs
description: On April 25, 2012, the Chinese government donated 85 vehicles to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The donation included 45 buses and 40 executive MG6 saloons. Some of the vehicles were distributed to government ministries and departments such as the CMED and the Office of the President and Cabinet.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120427e84q0005y&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.zbc.co.zw/news-categories/top-stories/18811-zim-receives-85-vehicles-from-china.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Xin Shunkang, Chinese ambassador to Zimbabwe (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Simbarashe Mumbengegwi, Foreign Affairs Minister (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: Donation of Agricultural Equipment
description: On September 7, 2006, The PRC donated US$250,000 worth of agricultural equipment to Liberia at the Booker T. Washington Institute in Kakata, Margibi County. The donation mainly included two sets of rice mills, two tractors with trailers, plough horrows, one combined harvest plowing machine, one sterilizer, two crop brush saws, 20 sprayers, one hatching box and two and raking boats. Other equipment include one constant temperaturer, three pumps, 30 tons of fertilizer, three tons of hybrid rice seeds, some pesticides, rain boots, raincoats, rakes, spades, hoes, tools, as well as teaching materials and some electrical appliances.
sources: http://lr.china-embassy.org/chn/sghdhzxxx/t270854.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.concern-liberians.org/chat_room/view_topic.php?id=22837&forum_id=1, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Agricultural Tools
description: On January 6, 2006 Liberian Information Minister William Allen said that the Chinese government offered 1 million USD worth of Agriculture tools to the incoming government. Chinese Ambassador to Liberia Lin Songtian presented the first shipment of 6 containers to Liberian President Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf on May 5, 2006. The shipment included over 630,000 cutlasses, axes, diggers, shovels, rakes, and other things. The second shipment of 18 containers is to arrive within a week. According to the Liberian Ministry of Agriculture 2006 Annual Report, the assortment of tools were successfully distributed during the 2006 Rice cropping season.
sources: http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-145413519/china-offers-liberian-farmers.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lr.china-embassy.org/eng/sbgx/ecoc/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.focac.org/eng/gfbd/t402706.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-140607269/china-gives-liberia-1m.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: William Allen, ; Dr. J Chris Toe,

title: Donation of Anti-Malaria Drugs
description: The initial report stated that China would donate US$1 million worth of anti-malaria drugs. A follow-up report stated that China had donated 20,000 doses of the drug, but did not comment on the cost.
sources: http://reliefweb.int/node/207729, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/i/jyjl/k/200605/20060502168316.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://allafrica.com/stories/200611030869.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Guilin Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd., Private Sector; Beijing Holley-Cotect Pharmaceuticals Co., Ltd., Private Sector
donor_agency: Guilin Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd., Private Sector; Beijing Holley-Cotect Pharmaceuticals Co., Ltd., Private Sector
contacts: Walter T. Gwenigale, M.D., ; Lin Songtian, ; Mr. Wei Jianguo,

title: Donation of Anti-Malaria Drugs
description: On June 24, 2011 The Liberian government and the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China signed a bilateral agreement for the provision of 3 million Yuan worth of anti-malaria drugs. The Chinese ambassador to Liberia, Zhao Jianhua signed the agreement, along with the Liberian Foreign Minister, Dr. Toga McIntosh. On March 21, 2012 466 cartons of anti-malaria medicines were donated to Liberia through the Chinese Embassy for the 'fulfillment of an exchange of letters signed June 23, 2011 between the two governments.'
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/201203260638.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://heritageliberia.net/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=160%3Aliberia-china-sign-bilateral-agreements&catid=52%3Ageneral-news&Itemid=89, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120327e83q000aw&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Walter Gwenigale, ; Toga McIntosh, ; Zhou Yuxiao,

title: Donation of Anti-Malaria Drugs
description: On June 24, 2006 the Chinese Ambassador to Togo, Yang Min presented anti-malaria drugs to the Togolese Minister of Health, Charles Kondi Agba. The donation was made up of oral and injectable drugs valued at over 33m CFA francs. This was the second donation of drugs that China offered to Togo, according to the measures proclaimed by the Chinese government during the Beijing summit, during the forum on the Sino-African cooperation in November 2006.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020080625e46p002ut&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Anti-Malaria Drugs--Artosunate and Hydrochroide tablets
description: On January 25, 2011 the Chinese Ambassador to Liberia Zhou Yuxiao donated anti-malaria drugs on behalf of the Chinese Government. Bernice T Dahn, Deputy Minister for Health Services and Chief Medical Officer for the Ministry of Health accepted the donation. The medication was reported to be mostly Artosunate and Hydrochroide tablets.
sources: http://www.limany.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=840%252525253Aliberia-china-donates-malaria-drugs-to-health-ministry&catid=71%252525253A2011-news&Itemid=28, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.tianjinwe.com/rollnews/201101/t20110128_3310342.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lr.china-embassy.org/eng/sghdhzxxx/t403049.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of Anti-Malaria Medicine
description: On January 28, 2010 Chinese Ambassador to Liberia, Zhou Yuxiao donated two batches of anti-malaria drugs to Liberia's Department of Health and Social Welfare on behalf of the Chinese government in Monrovia.
sources: http://lr.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/201001/20100106769211.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Liberian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Liberian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, Government Agency
contacts: Walter T. Gwenigale, M.D.,, ; Zhou Yuxiao,

title: Donation of Anti-Malarial Drugs
description: During a tour of Africa in February of 2007, Chinese President Hu Jintao signed agreements to donate anti-malaria drugs to Liberia. On March 12, 2007 US$138,000 of anti-malaria drugs were donated to the Liberia-China Malaria Control Center at the John F. Kennedy Medical Center in Sinkor. The Charge d'affairs of the Chinese Embassy, Mr. Gou Haodong made the presentation of the drugs to the Deputy Minister and Chief medical officer of the Republic of Liberia, Dr. Bernice Dahn on behalf of his country.See project # 1631 for Liberia-China Malaria Control Center
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/i/jyjl/k/200703/20070304468278.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020070313e33d000xs&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mg.co.za/print/2007-02-02-chinas-hu-brings-hope-pride-to-wartorn-liberia, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Anti-Malarial Drugs to the Congo
description: In May 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo, Li Shu Li, donated malaria drugs to the Congolese health authorities on behalf of China.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/notes/La-Chine-fait-don-de-medicaments-antipaludiques-au-Congo_b2080222.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); www.zfhz.org/plus/view.php?aid=2568, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.irinnews.org/report/91276/comoros-the-battle-against-malaria-lies-in-the-balance, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Li Shu Li, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Anti-malaria Drugs, 25 Vehicles and Mobile Inspection Unit
description: In January 2012, China provided Senegal with in-kind contributions consisting of anti-malarial drugs, 25 4x4 vehicles, and a mobile inspection unit. The Prime Minister of State, Souleymane NdÃ©nÃ© Ndiaye, and the Prime Minister of Health, Awa Marie Coll-Seck, were present at the ceremony where China presented Senegal with the gifts.
sources: http://www.gouv.sn/Conseil-des-ministres-du-19.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Awa Marie Coll-Seck, Senegalese Prime Minister of Health ; Souleymane NdÃ©nÃ© Ndiaye, Senegalese Prime Minister of State ; Abdoulaye Wade, President of Senegal from 2000 to 2012

title: Donation of Anti-malaria and lassa fever medicine
description: On August 4th, the Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy in Liberia extended a donation of anti-malaria and lassa fever medicine, on behalf of the Chinese Ministry of Health,to the Liberian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare. The donation was promised by the Chinese Deputy Minister of Health February 2005, during a health delegation visit. Deputy Minister Chen Xiaohong promised 10,000 doses of artesunate and 2,100 boxes of ribavirin injection
sources: http://roll.jrj.com.cn/news/2008-08-05/000003901073.html, Other
implementing_agency: Liberian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, Government Agency; China Ministry of Health, Government Agency
donor_agency: China Ministry of Health, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Liberian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, Government Agency

title: Donation of Badminton Equipment
description: In 2012, Chinese Ambassador to Congo, Li Shuli, donated a package of equipment that included 50 rackets and 26 boxes of birdies to the Congolese Badminton Federation. The donation reflects the cooperation agreement signed in April 2011 between the Chinese and Congolese Ministries of sports.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/notes/Don-du-materiel-de-travail-a-la-federation-congolaise-de-Badminton_b3642855.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Li Shuli, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Bus Shelters
description: On September 1, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo, Li Shu Li, donated five bus shelter to the Secretary General of the council of Brazzaville, Hubert Gadoua. These bus shelters were installed in front of the Chinese Embassy, Congo Telecom, at the entrance to the base hospital TalangaÃ¯ (6th district), about 100 meters to the left of the roundabout Bakongo (2nd district ), and at the bus stop on Alfred Raoul boulevard. Jiangsu International constructed the shelters at a cost of 50 million CFA francs. The Chinese company, Jiangsu International, intends to install other bus shelters in the Congolese capital.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-don-d-abri-bus-a-la-commune-de-Brazzaville_a8073.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: China Jiangsu International, State-Owned Company
contacts: Li Shuli, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Cape Coast Stadium
description: In 2012, the Chinese government has granted 30 million USD for the construction of Cape Coast Stadium in Ghana. Jiangxi International is responsible for implementing the project, construction was expected to begin in February 2013. The 15,000-seat capacity stadium will cover a total landmark of about 15,800 square meters and will have eight runway tracks, a football field with natural turf, two basketball courts and a handball court. It will also have an outdoor tennis court, a boxing training field, a gymnasium, athlete dormitory rooms, LED electronic display system and audio system. The Ghanaian government has committed 6.6 million cedi (3.35 million USD) to the project.
sources: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_Coast_Sports_Stadium, Other; http://elections.peacefmonline.com/politics/201208/129916.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ghanabusinessnews.com/2012/12/13/ghana-china-sign-30m-cape-coast-stadium-contract/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.moys.gov.gh/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=81:construction-of-cape-coast-stadium-to-start-in-february&catid=28:current-users&Itemid=1, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Jiangxi Corporation of International Economic and Technical Cooperation, State-Owned Company
donor_agency: Jiangxi Corporation of International Economic and Technical Cooperation, State-Owned Company
contacts: Hon. Clement Kofi Humado, Minister of Youth and Sports ; Gao Wenzhi, Economic Consular

title: Donation of Chemical Fertilizer
description: On February 12, 2007, the Chinese Ambassador to Niger and the Nigerian Minister of Agriculture attended the handover ceremony of China's donation of 650 metric tonnes of chemical fertilizer, worth 2.5 million CNY.
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn/pds/gjhdq/gj/fz/1206_40/1206x2/t297619.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of Chinese Books
description: In 2008, the Chinese Embassy in Ghana donated 300 sets of Chinese teaching books to the Department of Modern Languages at the University of Ghana. Dean Kono of the University of Ghana accepted the donation on behalf of the school, school Dean of the College of Liberal Arts, a Chinese government aid, and Chinese teachers and Chinese language teaching volunteers attended the ceremony. It is unclear what the financial value of the project is.
sources: http://www.ug.edu.gh/index1.php?linkid=212&archiveid=113&page=1&adate=11%2525252525252F09%2525252525252F2008, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.ug.edu.gh/index1.php?linkid=212&archiveid=113&page=1&adate=11%25252525252F09%25252525252F2008, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.chinaqw.com/hwjy/hjxw/200809/12/130529.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.hwjyw.com/info/news/200809/t20080912_22048.shtml, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.zjsql.com.cn/20090805/4100.html, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy
recipient_agencies: University of Ghana, Academic, Training and Research
contacts: Wang Lushan, ; Li Liang, ; Zou Xiong Dong,

title: Donation of Comoran Flags
description: On September 12, 2002 the ambassador of the People's Republic of China donated 2,750 flags of the Union of Comoros to the Comoran government. Ambassador Zhao Chunsheng said the 21m Comoran franc donation was an expression of the friendship by the Chinese government.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=bbcap00020020914dy9e003jt&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Computer Equipment
description: On February 24th, 2012, the Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo, Li Shuli, presented a donation of computer equipment to the city of Brazzaville. The donation included laptops, printers, multifunctional copiers, and digital cameras, among other equipment. The donation was received by the Minister of Scientific Research, Bruno Jean Richard Itoua.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-don-de-materiel-informatique-a-la-Cite-scientifique-de-Brazzaville_a11912.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); china-wire.org/?p=2127, Media Report, including Wikileaks; english.peopledaily.com.cn/90001/90777/90855/6582773.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Bruno Jean Richard Itoua, Minister of Scientific Research (Government of the Republic of the Congo); Liu Shuili, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Emergency Supplies
description: Between June 21 and 28, 2009 the Chinese gave the Gabonese military ten shipping containers including tents, medicine, laboratory equipment, and mobile medical units. This was after an exercise in which Gabonese and Chinese medical teams provided free medical and dental care to the local population. The equipment will be stocked at four locations around the country for use during emergencies. A financial amount for this project, as well as contacts, are unknown.This donation was received following a medical rescue training project ID#532 and joint military drills ID#286
sources: http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09LIBREVILLE307, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/jrzg/2009-06/19/content_1345145.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/jrzg/2009-06/17/content_1342221.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of Equipment to China-Liberia Malaria Prevention and Treatment Center
description: A delegation including the Deputy Minister of Commerce of the People's Republic of China, Fu Ziying carried out a four-day official visit from April 22 to 25, 2010. Followng Bilateral Discussions a signing ceremony between the Governments of the Republic of Liberia and the People's Republic of China where six agreements were signed, including one for the provision of 1.5 Million RMB Yuan in medical equipments for the China-Liberia Malaria Prevention and Treatment Center.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020100428e64s000q4&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.emansion.gov.lr/2press.php?news_id=1531&related=7&pg=sp, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: China-Liberia Malaria Prevention and Treatment Center, State-Owned Company

title: Donation of Equipment to Primary Schools
description: On October 18, 2012, the Ambassador of the People's Republic of China in Congo, Guan Jian, donated computer, educational and sporting equipment to two primary schools, Congo River School (6th district of Brazzaville) and Three Martyrs School (4th arrondissement) which were destroyed during the explosions on March 4th, 2012. The donation was received by the Minister for primary and secondary education, and literacy, Hellot Matson Mampouya. It includes, among other items, basketballs, handballs, soccer balls, volleyballs, computers, printers, reading books and notebooks.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/Education-La-Chine-prete-a-renforcer-sa-cooperation-avec-le-Congo_a13715.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Hellot Matson Mampouya, Minister for Primary and Secondary Education, and Literacy (Government of the Republic of the Congo); Guan Jian, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Farming Tools to a Local Agriculture Group--Diversity Farm (DF)
description: The Government of China has made an initial donation of several farming tools to a local agriculture group, Diversity Farm (DF). Diversity Farm is a local non-governmental organization funded to support the government's Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS) through agro-economic empowerment by providing free tree crops to rural farmers, rural public schools and clinics.
sources: http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-228482540/china-donates-money-farming.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Diversity Farm (D-FARM), National NGO

title: Donation of Foodstuffs and Other Items
description: On December 12, 2006 Chinese ambassador, Zhang Shixian presented a donation of four tonnes of rice, 60 cartons of sweets, toys, biscuits, exercise books, and other items to the Togolese Minister of Social Affairs, Memunatu Ibrahima.
sources: http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-155862606/chinese-envoy-donates-foodstuffs.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/world/2006-12/13/content_5482485.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of General Goods to Ghana
description: In 2004, the Chinese government donated $62,500 worth of general goods to Ghana. It is unclear what the goods are and how they were implemented.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=LQAF000020040312e03c0000c&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Health Equipment
description: On June 1, 2012, China presented assorted equipment, modern and traditional medicine to the Seychelles Ministry of Health at the Seychelles Hospital. Chinese ambassador Shi Zhongjun and Seychelles Health Minister Mitcy Larue had first signed a memorandum of understanding for the donation.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020120603e86300001&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Mitcy Larue, Ministry of Health (Seychelles Ministry of Health); Veronique Laporte, Principle Secretary for Health ; Shi Zhongjun, Chinese Ambassador

title: Donation of IT equipment
description: In 2006, China presented Seychelles a consignment of computers and other IT equipment to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation. The Chinese Ambassador to Seychelles handed over 15 computers, 4 heavy duty laser printers, 1 Canon photocopier, and 1 laminator. It is unclear how much the machinery is worth.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020060813e28d000rt&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_chn/gjhdq_603914/gj_603916/fz_605026/1206_606138/1206x2_606158/t267127.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Government Agency

title: Donation of IT equipment to Zimbabwean parliament
description: On June 12, 2012, outgoing Chinese ambassador to Zimbabwe, Mr. Xin Shunkang, donated IT equipment to the Parliament of Zimbabwe that included five laptops, 20 LG printers, 10 television sets and 20 scanners.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120614e86d000iz&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.newsday.co.zw/2012/06/12/2012-06-12-chinese-fear-early-zim-polls/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Parliament of Zimbabwe, Government Agency
contacts: Edna Madzongwe, President of the Senate ; Lovemore Moyo, Speaker of the House of Assembly ; Xin Shunkang, Chinese ambassador to Zimbabwe (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: Donation of Laboratory Equipment
description: In 2008, Chinese government provided the Government of the Republic of CÃ´te d'Ivoire with equipment for the fight against avian influenza, which consisted mainly of laboratory equipment to strengthen the analytical capacity of CÃ´te d'Ivoire, particularly in the area of â€‹â€‹bird flu. The donation totals 1,000,00 RMB (about 130 million CFA Francs).

title: Donation of Maize
description: On February 6, 2007, the Chinese Ambassador to Niger and Niger's Trade and Industry Secretary attended a handover ceremony for China's donation of 500 metric tons of yellow maize.
sources: http://www.gov.cn/gzdt/2007-02/08/content_521645.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of Materials for Elections
description: On September 3, 2010, China donated election materials to the Ivory Coast during a ceremony held at the headquarters of the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC), located at Two Plateaux, in the presence of Wei Wenhua, Chinese Ambassador to CÃ´te d'Ivoire and Mr. Youssouf Bakayoko, president of the CEI. The donation included 200 tricycles, 150 motorcycles, 1000 energy lamps and 100 mobile phones that were offered by the Chinese Embassy in CÃ´te d'Ivoire to the IRC for the 2010 elections.
sources: http://www.gouv.ci/actualite_1.php?recordID=1152, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://china-wire.org/?p=3906, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy
recipient_agencies: Independent Electoral Commission (CEI), Government Agency
contacts: Youssouf Bakayoko, President (Independent Electoral Commission (CEI)); Wei Wenhua, Ambassador to Ivory Coast (China)

title: Donation of Materials to the Electoral Commission
description: On December 5, 2011, China donated 180 laptops, 250 Desktop computers, 250 printers, 600 mobile phones, and 6 photocopiers that total 400 million CFA Franc, to the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC). At the ceremony, Youssouf Bakayoko, the IEC President said that was not the first gift from China; the Chinese government previously donated tricycles, solar lamps to the IEC (Project I.D. 30584).
sources: http://www.gouv.ci/actualite_1.php?recordID=1905, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/2011-12/05/c_122379905.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Wei Wenhua, Ambassador to the Ivory Coast (China); Youssouf Bakayoko, President, Independent Electoral Commission

title: Donation of Medical Equipment to Anti-Malarial Center
description: On August 13, 2008, the National Public Health Laboratory opened its center for the prevention and treatment of malaria in Brazzaville. The opening of the center was linked to a Chinese donation consisting of medical equipment and pharmaceutical drugs estimated to be worth 300 million CFA francs that was received by the Minister of Health, Social Affairs and Family, Emilienne Raoul. The center's goal is to conduct in-depth analysis and research on malaria. The Chinese government sent four experts, equipment, pharmaceuticals and reagents to ensure the operation of the center. These Chinese experts worked at the center for 45 days to train the Congolese staff.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/Ouverture-d-un-centre-de-prevention-et-de-traitement-du-paludisme-a-Brazzaville_a1207.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Li Shuli, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China); Emilienne Raoul, Minister of Health, Social Affairs and Family (Government of the Republic of the Congo)

title: Donation of Medicine
description: On December 10, 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Niger and Nigerian Acting Minister of Health attended the handover ceremony of China's donation of a batch of unspecified medicines. ã€€
sources: http://news.cntv.cn/20101212/104002.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of New Vehicles and Other Logistics (amount needs confirmation)
description: On July 22, 2004 the Chinese government donated 4 Jeeps, 2 mini buses, 80 Motorcycles, 110 sets of desktop computers with laser printers, 10 small generators, 100 police batons, one radio communication, and sick beds, among other items. In total, the items were valued at US$1,200,000. The handover ceremony took place at the Liberian Foreign Ministry in Monrovia, Liberia. Chinese Ambassador Lin Songtian expressed China's desire to help Liberia's transitional government in its reconstruction efforts.
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn/pds/wjdt/zwbd/t143804.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020040723e07n00231&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Office Equipment
description: On October 13, 2000, China donated office equipment worth 200,000 yuan (24,000 US dollars) to the Ethiopian Ministry Information and Culture. The office equipment includes computers, printers and TV sets, among other things.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=bbcapp0020010804dwae00bnq&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Ethiopia Ministry of Information and Culture, Government Agency

title: Donation of Office Equipment
description: In August 2009, the Ministry of cooperation, solidarity and humanitarian action received a donation of office equipment worth 2 million CNY from China. The donation included computers, laser printers, copiers, scanners, cameras, furniture, three vehicles and other objects.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-don-du-materiel-de-bureau-au-ministere-de-la-cooperation-et-de-la-solidarite_a4772.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Charles Zacharie Bowao, Minister of Cooperation, Solidarity, and Humanitarian Action ; Lu Shuli, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Office Equipment to the Ministry of Foreign Affiars
description: On October 18th, 2007, the Chinese Ambassador to Congo, Wo Ruidi, donated computers and office equipment to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Francophonie on behalf of China. The donation consisted of 80 computers, 80 plasma screens, scanners, printers, memory sticks, and other supplies.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-un-don-de-materiel-informatique-au-ministere-congolais-des-Affaires-etrangeres_a104.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Wo Ruidi, Ambassador to the Republic of the Congo (China)

title: Donation of Sports Equipment to Congolese Ministry
description: In 2012, the Chinese government donated 208 boxes of sports equipment worth about 82 million CFA francs to the Congolese Ministry. These donations were intended for the National Games of the National Schools and College Sports (Onssu). This gift was the result of commitments made by the two governments in relation to the Cooperation Agreement on Sports and Physical Education, signed in Beijing on April 11th, 2011.
sources: http://www.congo-site.com/La-Chine-fait-don-de-materiels-sportifs-au-ministere-des-sports_a12888.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Leon Alfred Opimbat, Minister of Sport and Physical Education

title: Donation of Tractor Spare Parts
description: On August 19, 2009 a Chinese Embassy official and the Secretary General of Niger's Agriculture Ministry attended a handover ceremony for China's donation of tractor spare parts.
sources: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/i/jyjl/k/200908/20090806471244.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Niger, Government Agency

title: Donation of Two Container Scanners
description: In September of 2011, an exchange of notes for the supply of two sets of Nuctech Mobile Container/Vehicle Inspection Systems was signed. On July 20, 2011 Chinese Ambassador to Liberia Zhao Jianhua 'hand delivered' two container scanners to Liberiaâ€™s Minister of Finance, Amara M. Konneh. The scanners will be used by the Bureau of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance to generate government revenues. During the ceremony a US$6 million grant agreement was signed by the two officials to cover the cost of the scanners. The scanners will be utilized at two of the countryâ€™s major ports of entry-the Freeport of Monrovia and the Roberts International Airport (RIA). The mobile scanners are equipped with technology that allows it users to check containers without opening them. The grant money came from an agreement made in September of 2011 (project id#1822)
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/201109290278.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=APASENE020110928e79s000dy&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://theliberiantimes.com/?p=10778, Other; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120724e87n000wa&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Ministry of Finance, Government Agency; Liberian Bureau of Customs and Excise, Government Agency
factiva_sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=APASENE020110928e79s000dy&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120724e87n000wa&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of Unspecified Supplies
description: On December 15, 2006, the Assistant to the Chinese Minister of Commerce and the Nigerian Minister of Foreign Affairs, Cooperation and African Integration signed an exchange of letters involving the Chinese government's donation of 2 million CNY worth of unspecified supplies (but they may be presumed to be medical supplies since this donation accompanied anti-malarial medications; MOU). The current status of this project and whether or not the supplies were actually delivered cannot be determined.
sources: http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2006-12-15/210110783574s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: AÃ¯chatou Mindaoudou Souleymane, ; Mr. Wang Chao,

title: Donation of a Consigment of Drugs
description: On October 23, 2006 China donated a consignment of drugs valued over US$30,000 to the Liberia's Health Ministry. The drugs were intended to help fight Lassa fever epidemics in Nimba and Bong counties. The total consignment was reportedly three hundred treatment medicines that can be used to treat three hundred lassa fever patients. Chinese Ambassador Lin Songtian presented the drugs to Health and Social Welfare Minister Dr. Walter Gwenigale at the Health Ministry.
sources: http://www.irinnews.org/Report/61433/LIBERIA-China-steps-in-to-end-lassa-fever-outbreak, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://allafrica.com/stories/200610240633.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of anti-malaria drugs
description: On April 20, 2009 at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs offices in Kampala, Chong Quan, the Chinese Assistant Minister of Commerce, handed over anti-malaria drugs, ARCO and Duo-Cotexin, worth 400,000 million USD to Richard Nduhura, Uganda's Health Minister.
sources: http://www.newvision.co.ug/D/8/13/678747, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Chong Quan, Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs ; Richard Nduhura, Minister of Health

title: Donation of anti-malaria drugs
description: On October 8, 2010, the Chinese government donated anti-malarial drugs worth 1 billion UGX to the Uganda. China's ambassador to Uganda, Sun Heping, handed over the donation to Richard Nduhuura, State Minister for General Duties in the Health Ministry.
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/201010110015.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Sun Heping, Chinese ambassador to Uganda ; Richard Nduhura,

title: Donation of anti-malaria drugs
description: On January 18, 2010, the Chinese government donated over 244,000 doses of anti-malarial drugs worth 400,000 USD to the Uganda. China's ambassador to Uganda, Sun Heping, handed over the donation of 144,000 doses of Arco and 100,000 doses of Duo-Cotexin to Richard Nduhuura, State Minister for General Duties in the Health Ministry.
sources: http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/xinhua/2011-09-09/content_3746733.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.monitor.co.ug/News/National/-/688334/1232382/-/bjbdpsz/-/index.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://vlex.cn/vid/donates-doses-malarial-drugs-uganda-75282057, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Richard Nduhura, State Minister for General Duties (Health Ministry) ; Sun Heping, Chinese ambassador to Uganda

title: Donation of anti-malaria drugs and establishment of a malaria lab
description: China donated anti-malaria drugs to Madagascar and also established a designated malaria lab at Befelatanana Hospital in Madagascar. During the 2006 Forum on on China-Africa Cooperation in Beijing, the Chinese government promised to construct 30 malaria treatment centers in Africa, the center in Madagascar is the fifth. Further details about the project are uncertain.
sources: http://news.sohu.com/20091005/n267176799.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BMIPME0020111026e7ap00001&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://wikileaks.org/cable/2010/02/10ANTANANARIVO72.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of anti-malaria medicine
description: On May 15, 2007 in Beijing, Rwandan President Paul Kagame and Chinese President Hu Jintao signed an agreement for China to provide Rwanda with anti-malaria medicine. The amount, current status, and start and end dates are unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020070516e35g000p2&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of anti-malaria medicine
description: In November 2009, Chinese Ambassador to Sierra Leone, Qui Shao Fang donated anti-malaria drugs to the Ministry of Health and Sanitation in Freetown. The ceremony was held at the Central Medical Stores in Freetown. The donation came as a result of the certificate signed between the Sierra Leone Government and the PRC to strengthen bilateral relations.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAP00020091129e5bt000xd&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Ministry of Health and Sanitation, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Ministry of Health and Sanitation, Government Agency

title: Donation of anti-malarial medicine
description: On November 9, 2009, Mali's Minister of Health Oumar Ibrahima TourÃ© received a donation of medical equipment and supplies from Zhang Guoqing, China's Ambassador in Mali. The donation included 230 million CFA francs of antimalarial drugs. The donation also included equipment and medicines worth 50 million CFA francs to be delivered to Kati Hospital (See Project #30664) and equipment and medicines worth 85 million CFA francs for the use of the Chinese medical mission hospitals in Kati, Sikasso and Markala (See Project #30665).
sources: http://www.primature.gov.ml/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=3236:cooperation-sanitaire--la-chine-renforce-le-mali&catid=21&Itemid=100084, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Zhang Guoqing, Ambassador to Mali (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Oumar Ibrahima TourÃ©, Minister of Health (Government of Mali)

title: Donation of antimalarial drugs
description: On June 1, 2012, the Malian Minister of State, Mr. Sadio Lamine Sow, signed an agreement with the Ambassador of the People's Republic of China to Mali, Mr. Cao Zhang Ming. The agreement included a donation of antimalarial drugs worth 3 million CNY or 210 million CFA francs (XOF). At the same time, the Chinese government donated 3,000 tonnes of grain (Project #30228).
sources: http://www.diplomatie.gouv.ml/voir_actu.aspx?lactu=319, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Cao Zhang Ming, Ambassador ; Sadio Lamine Sow, Minister

title: Donation of assorted items to women's groups
description: In December 2012, the Chinese Ambassador to Liberia Zhao Jianhua donated several assorted items including sewing machines, electronic fans, bags of rice, among other items to the Sirleaf Market Women Fund, Ever Orphanage Home, Group of 77, Concerned Women for Development and Presbyterian Today Mission School.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020121229e8cs000hb&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://theinquirer.com.lr/content1.php?main=news&news_id=1493, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Sirleaf Market Women Fund, National NGO; Concerned Women for Development, National NGO; Ever Orphanage Home, National NGO; Group of 77, National NGO; Presbyterian Today Mission School, Academic, Training and Research
recipient_agencies: Sirleaf Market Women Fund, National NGO; Concerned Women for Development, National NGO; Ever Orphanage Home, National NGO; Group of 77, National NGO; Presbyterian Today Mission School, Academic, Training and Research
contacts: Zhao Jianhua, Chinese Ambassador to Liberia (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Vivian Cherue, Deputy Minister at the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare

title: Donation of buses
description: In May 2012, the third batch of bus donations arrived in Seychelles, and they are being used by the Seychelles Public Transport Corporation. The buses each have 30 seats and rear engines.
sources: http://www.nation.sc/index.php?art=27380, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020111023e7an000b5&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://sc.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201205/20120508119263.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://wolfganghthome.wordpress.com/2012/05/04/seychelles-public-transport-corporation-gets-10-more-busses-gifted-by-china/, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs

title: Donation of cholera medication
description: Following the cholera outbreak in Sierra Leone during the summer of 2012, the Chinese government donated medicines to help fight the epidemic. The anti-cholera drugs amounted to a cost of 1 million CNY. The most recent sources stated that the medicine was en route to Sierra Leone.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120903e8930016t&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://m.iol.co.za/article/view/s/81/a/286117, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of computer equipment
description: In 2010, China donated computer equipment worth 11.5 million Euros to Senegal. Exactly what comprised the donation and where it was delivered is unclear.
sources: http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gJJ3NHkRMxdzhcyF9igz0FD-h_og, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of computers to Department of Immigration
description: On May 31, 2013, the Chinese government donated 20 computers worth 6.6 million MWK to the Department of Immigration. The donation included 10 new desktop computers and 10 laptops. The donation was handed over in Lilongwe by the Chinese Deputy Ambassador to Malawi, Zhang Yuebang.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020130603e963000mn&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.manaonline.gov.mw/index.php/business/item/3729-china-donates-computers-to-immigration-department, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Malawi Department of Immigration
contacts: Zhang Yuebang, Chinese Deputy Ambassador to Malawi (Chinese Embassy); Chrispin Sibande Banda, Chief Immigration Officer (Malawi Department of Immigration)

title: Donation of computers to newspaper
description: On January 5, 2006 in a meeting with Rwanda's The New Times Publications Managing Director, Edward Rwema, and Human Resource Manager, Emmanuel Kalisa, Chinese Ambassador Qi Deen donated two Tongxi computers to the organization. The value of the computers is unknown.
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/200601060182.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: The New Times (Rwanda), Private Sector
contacts: Emmanuel Kalisa, ; Edward Rwema , ; Qi Deen,

title: Donation of computers to promote education
description: On August 9, 2002 in Kampala, Chinese ambassador to Uganda Li Qiangmin, on behalf of the Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China, handed over 50 sets of computers and the relevant accessories to Uganda's Minister of Education and Sports Edward Khiddu Makubuya. The computers will go to Makerere University and Mbarara University of Science and Technology to set up computer labs. The amount is unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=xnews00020020827dy89002d7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
location_details: Makerere University and Mbarara University of Science and Technology

title: Donation of corn
description: In 2003, China donated 2,000 metric tonnes of corn to Lesotho to aid famine victims. One source claimed 2,000 metric tons of corn were donated while another claimed 200 metric tons of corn were donated. This is possibly part of Project #30598.
sources: http://ls.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200303/20030300073744.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.ls/articles/2002/Aid-%20Africa%20Donates%20Food.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of cultural books and CDs
description: On December 24th the Xinhua News Agency donated over 3,000 copies of French books and 200 CDs involving multiple areas of China's political economy, literature and art, ethnic and religious, urban construction, the concentrated expression of China's traditional culture and contemporary culture, to Maliâ€™s media agency.Chinese Ambassador Zhang Guoqing expressed continued strengthening of cooperation between the two countriesâ€™media. No other information could be found about this project.
sources: http://finance.qq.com/a/20101225/001604.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Xinhua News Agency, Government Agency
donor_agency: Xinhua News Agency, Government Agency

title: Donation of de-mining equipment
description: On December 19, 2001, the Chinese government donated de-mining equipment worth more than $100,000 U.S. dollars to the Ethiopian government.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=xnews00020011219dxcj006hi&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of drugs and medical equipment
description: In September 2012, China signed an agreement with Mali for the donation of medication and health equipment. The total value of the donation is 214,000 USD. One piece of equipment is a medical imaging table used to repair vertebrae during neurosurgery. Visiting Chinese medical teams and Malian doctors will use the equipment.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020120901e891004jx&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.primature.gov.ml/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=9056:hopital-du-mali--un-nouveau-coup-de-main-de-la-chine&catid=21&Itemid=100084, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of equipment for cultural activities
description: On May 30, 2001 at the National Theatre Green Room in Kampala, Chinese ambassador Zhang Xujiang handed over a donation of equipment worth over 65.8 million UGX to the Minister of Gender, Labor and Social Development, Janat Mukwaya, to promote cultural activities in Uganda. The equipment included computers, cameras, sewing machines and footballs. The items were to be distributed to the ministry, Kampiringisa Rehabilitation Centre, and Mpumudde Girls Rehabilitation Centre in Jinja.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcap00020010710dx650052b&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of equipment for parliament office building
description: On September 14, 2006, in a meeting between China's Director General, Western Asia and African Affairs, Zhou Yabin, and Rwandan Ministry of Foreign Affairs officials, China agreed to provide equipment for the Rwandan Parliament office building. The amount, current status, and start and end dates are unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020060914e29e000nv&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of farm supplies and seeds
description: In 2007, China donated seeds and farm supplies for internally displaced persons in the north and north eastern regions of Uganda. In 2008, 2.6 billion UGX worth of seeds had yet to be delivered. The start and end dates are unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020080410e44a000hj&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Reagan Okumu, Parliament Member from Aswa ; Tarsis Kabwegyere, Ministry of Disaster Preparedness

title: Donation of food aid
description: In September 2012, China pledged to donate another batch of food aid to Lesotho worth 8.4 million LSL. The donation, which was planned to be distributed through the World Food Program, is the second time China has given food aid to Lesotho in 2012 (Project ID#30601). In September, the Prime Minister had appealed to development partners for humanitarian food assistance following reports that about 725,000 people were facing food crises in the country.
sources: http://www.gov.ls/articles/2012/china_responds_to_pm_appeal.php, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
contacts: Hu Ding Xiang, Ambassador to Lesotho (China)

title: Donation of garbage trucks
description: On December 8, 2003 at City Hall, Kampala, the Chinese Ambassador, Li Qiangming handed over 30 garbage trucks worth 12 million CNY to Finance, Planning, and Economic Development Minister Gerald Ssendaula. 20 of the grabage trucks were given to Kampala City Council, with 2 each going to Jinja, Mbarara, Mbale, Entebbe and Masaka.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afnws00020021011dyab002mn&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
location_details: Kampala, Jinja, Mbarara, Mbale, Entebbe and Masaka

title: Donation of ginger seeds
description: On July 7, 2003, China granted 53.3 tons of ginger seeds to the Agriculture Ministry through the Ministry of Trade and Industry. The 53.3 tons, equivalent to 4820, was distributed to farmers in the traditional ginger growing districts of Moyamba, Kambia, Freetown, Bombali, and Port Loko. 12 trucks were loaded for Moyamba with 3040 cartons of ginger seeds, 11 trucks for Kambia with 1000 cartons and 810 cartons for the Greater Freetown.According to the Director of export at the Trade Ministry, Mr. Abu Bakarr Kebbae the ginger seeds are a grant from the Chinese government, although the Sierra Leone government has to give it on loan to farmers associations.The director of export at the Trade Ministry, Mr. Abu Bakarr Kebbae, said that the planting would be propagated for two seasons (of six months each), replanting for the second season almost immediately after the first harvest, after which the ginger would be ready for export. He further noted that over 980 farmers associations would benefit from this programme, adding that the donation to the government was to help with its poverty alleviation project.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=afnws00020030713dz7d00130&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://sl.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200307/20030700105328.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Ministry of Trade and Industry, Government Agency; Agriculture Ministry , Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Ministry of Trade and Industry, Government Agency; Agriculture Ministry , Government Agency
location_details: Moyamba, Kambia, Freetown, Bombali and Port Loko

title: Donation of goods to celebrate Burundi's fiftieth anniversary of independence
description: In March 2012, China donated a variety of goods to Burundi for the African country's fiftieth anniversary of independence. The goods include vehicles, computer hardware, shovels and pickaxes, and seats for stadiums under construction. The materials were kept in the President of Burundi Pierre Nkurunziza's warehouse in Ngagara, Bujumbura.
sources: http://www.burundi-gov.bi/Burundi-Developpement-Le-President,2115, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of goods to victims of cyclone
description: On March 13, 2012, China provided emergency assistance to victims of cyclone Giovanna in rural town of Tanjombato, south of capital Antananarivo, through its embassy and Chinese associations. The donation included white rice, oil, beans, blankets, buckets and school kits for students. The associations involved included, among others, the Friends Club of China, the Association of Chinese companies in Madagascar and the Associations of Chinese vendors, who work closely with the Office of the Economic and Commercial under the Chinese Embassy.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020120313e83d004mq&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://vlex.cn/vid/china-aid-cyclone-giovanna-madagascar-368551726, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Associations of Chinese vendors; Friends Club of China; Association of Chinese companies in Madagascar
implementing_agency: Office of the Economic and Commercial under the Chinese Embassy
donor_agency: Office of the Economic and Commercial under the Chinese Embassy; Associations of Chinese vendors; Friends Club of China; Association of Chinese companies in Madagascar
contacts: Rakotondrabe Maurice, Tanjombato mayor (Government of Madagascar); Wang Hongwei, President (Association of Chinese companies in Madagascar)

title: Donation of grain
description: On June 1, 2012, the Malian Minister of State, Mr. Sadio Lamine Sow, signed an agreement with the Chinese Ambassador to Mali, Cao Zhang Ming. The agreement included the donation of almost 3,000 tons of grain to the Malian government. This donation has an estimated worth of 25 million CNY or about 1.8 billion CFA francs (XOF). At the same time, the Chinese government donated 3 million CNY worth of antimalarial medication (Project #30229).
sources: http://www.diplomatie.gouv.ml/voir_actu.aspx?lactu=319, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Cao Zhang Ming, Chinese Ambassador to Mali (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Sadio Lamine Sow, Minister of State (Government of Mali)

title: Donation of land mine detectors and experts
description: In January 2009, China donated 70 sets of landmine detectors and accessories to Egypt for the use of detecting land mines and unexploded ordinances left from World War II. Four Chinese experts were also dispatched to Egypt to train local mine-sweepers. They also supplied Egypt with mine-sweeping technology.
sources: http://www.the-monitor.org/custom/index.php/region_profiles/print_theme/1691#_ftnref10, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90776/90883/6606268.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of mechanical equipment for road construction
description: On November 6, 2009 China donated US$3.6 million of mechanical equipment for road construction. Togolese President Faure Gnassingbe presided over a ceremony along with Chinese ambassador to Togo, Yang Min and Togo's Public Works Minister, Comlan Kadjie.Yang Min.This project may be related to project ID#392.
sources: http://english.cctv.com/20091106/104810.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of medical drugs and equipment for Chinese medical missions
description: On November 9, 2009, Mali's Minister of Health Oumar Ibrahima TourÃ© received a donation of medical equipment and supplies from Zhang Guoqing, China's Ambassador in Mali. The donation included equipment and medicines worth 85 million CFA francs for the use of the Chinese medical mission hospitals in Kati, Sikasso and Markala. The donation also included equipment and medicines worth 50 million CFA francs to be delivered to Kati Hospital (See Project #30664) and 230 million CFA francs of antimalarial drugs (See Project #30663).
sources: http://www.primature.gov.ml/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=3236:cooperation-sanitaire--la-chine-renforce-le-mali&catid=21&Itemid=100084, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/world/2009-11/11/content_12433203.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zhang Guoqing, Ambassador to Mali (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Oumar Ibrahima TourÃ©, Minister of Health (Government of Mali)

title: Donation of medical equipment
description: In 2002 and 2003, China donated medical equipment worth 361,000 USD, with initial commitment the same amount. The location is unknown.
sources: http://www.aercafrica.org/documents/china-africa-country-cases/Uganda_Aid_Relations.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy

title: Donation of medical equipment to Jackson Doe Referral Hospital
description: On September 13, 2012, the Chinese government donated medical equipment and supplies valued at 1.5 million USD to the Liberian government for used at the Jackson F. Doe Memorial Referral Hospital in Tappita, Nimba County. The equipment includes a mammogram machine, transurethral resection of prostate sets, a urological surgery instrument parcel, an abdominal surgery operation parcel, Galactophore surgery operation parcel, among other items. As part of the agreement, Chinese experts helped to install the equipment.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020120917e89h000fq&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://nationalchronicleliberia.com/news/politics/438/chinese-embassy-donates-medical-equipment-drugs-t/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Jackson F. Doe Memorial Referral Hospital
contacts: Dr. Francis Kateh, Hospital Medical Director ; Dr. Walter T. Gwenigale, Liberia's Health and Social Welfare Minister ; Zhao Jianhua, Chinese Ambassador

title: Donation of medical equipment to Motebang Hospital
description: In March 2012, China's Vice Minister of Health, Liu Qian handed over medical equipment to Motebang Hospital in Leribe. Reports say it totaled '230,000 equipment', but it does not specify units. The equipment included an infant scale, gynecological and obstetrical sets, a blood sugar test unit, a portable ultrasonic diagnostic instrument, an electrocardiogram instrument, a fetal heart check unit and a high pressure steam sterilization pot. The donation was handed over during the Vice Minister's three-day visit to Lesotho.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=APASENE020120418e84i000p3&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ls.china-embassy.org/eng/xwdt/t976582.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.ls/articles/2012/qian_hands_over_medical_equipment.php, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Dr. Liu Qian, Chinese Deputy Minister of Health

title: Donation of medical equipment to the Flacq hospital
description: On July 1, 2009, Chinese Ambassador to Mauritius Bian Yanhua handed over a donation of medical equipment to the Flacq hospital. The equipment was valued at about 3.6 million CNY.
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn/gxh/tyb/zwbd/t570934.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Bian Yanhua, Chinese Ambassador to Mauritius

title: Donation of medical instruments and medicine
description: On August 28-30, 2006, a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Chinese Communist Party, Wu Guanzheng , and and Rwandan President Paul Kagame exchanged a letter according to which China will provide some 2 million CNY worth of medical instruments, general medicine, and anti-malaria medicine. The current status and start and end dates are unknown.
sources: http://rw2.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/bilateralvisits/200609/20060903062696.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFNWS00020060914e29e000nv&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of meteorological equipment
description: On August 15, 2002, China donated meteorological equipment to Lesotho that includes 10 sets of thermohygraphs, 10 sets of self-recording rain gauges, and 10 anemometers. The handing over ceremony was held at the National Convention Centre in Maseru. The equipment will enhance the capacity of the Lesotho Meteorological Service to accurately measure rainfall, temperature, humidity and wind.
sources: http://www.gov.ls/articles/2002/Chines%20Ambassador%20Weather%20Equip.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Lesotho Meteorological Service (LMS), Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Lesotho Meteorological Service (LMS), Government Agency
contacts: Monyane Moleleki, Minister of Natural Resources (Lesotho Government); Zhang Xianyi, Ambassador to Lesotho (China)

title: Donation of mobile clinics
description: On June 2, 2010, an agreement was signed by China's Ambassador to Sudan, Li Chengwen, and Sudan's Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs on handing over about ten mobile clinics and medical equipment for Darfur at the cost of 10m Chinese yuan. The ceremony was attended by Ambassador Charles Menyang, Sudan's Undersecretary of the Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs. The exact commitment date is unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCMEP0020100603e6630002t&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of musical instruments
description: On March 14, 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Sudan, Li Chengwen, and Sudanese Minister of Culture, Al-Samawal Khalafalla, attended a ceremony for the donation of musical instruments from China to Sudan. The amount is unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020110314e73e00338&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of musical instruments
description: On February 16, 2009 in Khartoum, China's Ambassador to Sudan Li Chengwen and the Government of South Sudan Minster of Culture Abino Akur Akur attended a ceremony for the donation of instruments from China to the South Sudanese government. The musical instruments amounted to 64 pieces, including violoncellos, violins, trombones and others. The amount is unknown.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020090216e52g0073p&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of office equipment
description: On December 16, 2004, the Chinese government donated 3 million Kenyan shillings worth of office equipment to the Somali transitional government. The certificate of receipt was signed by the Chinese Ambassador to Kenya, Guo Chongli, and Somali President, Abdullahi Yusuf Ahmed.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020041216e0cg005ek&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of office equipment for government of Cote d'Ivoire
description: On May 9, 2012, the Ambassador of China Zhang Guoqing delivered a Chinese donation of office materials to the the Minister of Foreign Affairs Daniel Kablan. The donation included 500 computers, 500 printers, 500 UPS, 44 vehicles, and 10 ambulances. This came as a gift to help during post-crisis reconstruction.
sources: http://www.gouv.ci/actualite_1.php?recordID=2357, Other; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/wjdt/wshd/t833942.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of office equipment to new Ministry of Foreign Affairs Building
description: In 2009, Ghana, with the assistance of the Chinese government, constructed a new office building for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Accra (Project #1497). Work on the office complex is expected to begin by the end of 2009 and to be completed within two years. Within this project was a donation of office equipment to the ministry which comprised of 25 Dell desktop computers, five IBM laptops and 10 HP printers all estimated at 40,000 U.S. dollars, was the first donation to the ministry following the fire that razed its building two weeks prior to the November media report.
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/wjb/zwjg/zwbd/t624818.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020091104e5b40096m&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020091103e5b3002gy&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
donor_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
factiva_sources: http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020091104e5b40096m&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAP00020091103e5b3002gy&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of office equipment to political party
description: On January 15, 2008 in Kimihurura, Chinese Ambassador to Rwanda, Sun Shuzhong, gave office equipment and electronic gadgets worth 60 million RWF to the Rwanda Patriotic Front (RPF), represented by RPF Secretary General, Francois Ngarambe. The package, donated by the Chinese Communist Party, includes computers (desktops and laptops) with accessories, stereo equipment, digital video and photo cameras and sound equipments among others.
sources: http://business.highbeam.com/3548/article-1G1-173455754/china-donates-computers-rpf, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Communist Party, Political Party
donor_agency: Chinese Communist Party, Political Party
recipient_agencies: Rwandan Patriotic Front, Political Party

title: Donation of office supplies to Bioko Chamber of Commerce
description: On July 10, 2012, China donated office supplies to Equatorial Guinea's Chamber of Commerce of Bioko. China's Ambassador in Equatorial Guinea, Wang Shixiong, and the President of the Chamber of Commerce of Bioko, Gregorio Boho Camo, signed the accrediting document.
sources: http://www.guineaecuatorialpress.com/noticia.php?id=2816, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://gq.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t950054.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Chamber of Commerce of Bioko, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Chamber of Commerce of Bioko, Government Agency
contacts: Gregorio Boho Camo, President of the Chamber of Commerce of Bioko ; Wang Shixiong, Ambassador to Equitorial Guinea (China)

title: Donation of office supplies to Democratic Party
description: On March 3, 2012, the Chinese Embassy donated office supplies to the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea. The donation was made at the headquarters of the Chinese Embassy in Malabo and consisted of various office supplies, audiovisual and computer equipment. According to Chinese Ambassador Wang Shixiong, the donation was made at the request of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea (PDGE), and the material will improve working conditions.
sources: http://www.guineaecuatorialpress.com/noticia.php?id=2420, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://gq.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201203/20120308006775.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea (PDGE), Political Party
contacts: Lucas Nguema Esono, Secretary General of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea ; Wang Shixiong, Ambassador to Equitorial Guinea (China)

title: Donation of radio stations
description: On October 24, 2011, South Sudanese Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Barnaba Marial Benjamin, and Chinese Ambassador to Juba, Li Zhiguo. signed an agreement for China to donate a number of radio stations to South Sudan to promote media development. The amount, current status, and start and end dates are unknown.
sources: http://www.sudantribune.com/China-grants-South-Sudan-31-5-mln,40523, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://blogs.rnw.nl/medianetwork/china-to-donate-radio-stations-to-south-sudan, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of reproductive health medical equipment
description: On June 30, 2009, the Chinese government donated medical equipment worth 300,000 USD to Uganda to boost its effort to promote reproductive health. Wang Zeshan, Charge d'affaires at the Chinese Embassy handed over the equipment to Uganda's Health Minister Stephen Malinga. The equipment included an ultra sound, a urine analysis equipment, an ECG machine, a mammogram machine, and some theatre lamps and tables. The donation will go to the Mulago and Jinja hospitals.
crs_sector_name: Population Policies / Programmes and Reproductive Health
sources: http://allafrica.com/stories/200907060552.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://vlex.cn/vid/china-donates-medical-equipment-uganda-60248559, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Stephen Malinga, Minister of Health ; Wang Zeshan, Charge d'Affaires

title: Donation of reproductive health medical equipment
description: In 2010, the Chinese government donated reproductive health medical equipment worth 40 million Kenyan shillings to the Kenyan government.
crs_sector_name: Population Policies / Programmes and Reproductive Health
sources: http://csis.org/files/publication/111122_Freeman_ChinaEmergingGlobalHealth_Web.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.planning.go.ke/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=424:handing-over-of-contraceptive-on-26th-july-2012&catid=53:minister&Itemid=93, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of road maintenance vehicles
description: On May 12, 2000, Mr. Zhang Xujiang, the Chinese ambassador to Uganda, handed over a donation of 60 Jiefang tipper trucks worth 3.2 million USD to Andraule Awuzu, Uganda's State Minister for Works. The trucks were to be used for road maintenance around Uganda.
sources: http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afnws00020021107dw5d01ac6&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=qedcer0020010815dw2s0001f&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
